etymology.description: 燕麦(燕麥) (yànmài, "oats") + 粥(粥) (zhōu, "porridge") refers to a dish made by cooking oats into a thick, warm porridge.
etymology.interpretation: 燕麦粥(燕麥粥) (yànmàizhōu, "oatmeal porridge") combines the concept of oats and porridge to specify a type of porridge made with oats, commonly consumed as a breakfast dish.

examples.chinese: 我早餐喝燕麦粥(我早餐喝燕麥粥)。
examples.english: I drink oatmeal porridge for breakfast.

examples.chinese: 妈妈做燕麦粥(媽媽做燕麥粥)，味道鲜美(味道鮮美)。
examples.english: Mom makes oatmeal porridge, and it tastes delicious.

examples.chinese: 冬天早晨常喝燕麦粥(冬天早晨常喝燕麥粥)，能暖胃驱寒(能暖胃驅寒)。
examples.pinyin: Dōngtiān zǎochén cháng hē yànmàizhōu, néng nuǎn wèi qū hán.
examples.english: Drinking oatmeal porridge on a winter morning can warm the stomach and fend off the cold.
